testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlHARControlScheduleRequest dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.7.8 [Need to Share HAR Schedule] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Device Schedule is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.8.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N68R440_Restrictions___Device_Schedule_Supported = ${TMDD_N68R440_Restrictions___Device_Schedule_Supported}
Step 3 CONFIGURE: Define the message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: RequestMessage: ${RequestMessage}
Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 5 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}

Step 6 REQUEST-RESPONSE-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlHARControlScheduleRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N68R813_Send_HAR_Schedule_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter REQUESTMESSAGE = RequestMessage ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected
Step 7 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 7.1 VERIFY that element organization-information exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.2 VERIFY that element device-id exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.3 VERIFY that element time-base-schedule-number exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.4 VERIFY that element time-base-schedule-month exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.5 VERIFY that element time-base-schedule-day exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.6 VERIFY that element time-base-schedule-date exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.7 VERIFY that element time-base-schedule-day-plan exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.8 VERIFY that element day-plan-hour exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.9 VERIFY that element day-plan-minute exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.10 VERIFY that element last-update-time exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.11 VERIFY that element hARControlScheduleMsg exists.
Step 7.12 IF TMDD_N68R440_Restrictions___Device_Schedule_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 7.12.1 VERIFY that element restrictions exists within each instance of hARControlScheduleMsg.har-control-schedule-item.device-control-schedule-header
Step 7.13 VERIFY that the values within the RESPONSE message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content
